content.text:
A test to screen for cervical cancer was used and the results of the screening test were shown below. The sensitivity of the test was. <image 1>

A. 80%
B. 20%
C. 60%
D. 40%

To calculate the sensitivity of the test, we need to use the formula:

\[ \text{Sensitivity} = \frac{\text{True Positives}}{\text{True Positives} + \text{False Negatives}} \times 100\% \]

From the table:
- True Positives ( (Cervical cancer patients with positive test) = 800
- False Negatives ( (Cervical cancer patients with negative test) = 200

Plugging these values into the formula:

\[ \text{Sensitivity} = \frac{{800}}{{800 + 200}} \times 100\% = \frac{{800}}{{1000}} \times 100\% = 80\% \]

So, the sensitivity of the test is 80%.

The correct answer is:
A. 80%
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
